result.execSummary:
The defendant Camilla B Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total costs to be paid during the term of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: 10:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Camilla B Taylor in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Camilla B Taylor.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the Defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters guilty pleas as to counts 1 and 2.  Court accepts the pleas, finding them to be free and voluntary, and finds the Defendant guilty as to their pleas.  State as to sentencing.  Counsel as to sentencing.  Statements by Defendant.  Court renders judgment.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

22R 002252  Bond posted at Sheriff's Office on 2/28/2022.

Not to possess any weapons. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container.

1:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Camilla B Taylor appeared by video, in custody. Atty Heather Dvoran appears stating defendant will qualify for public defender representation. Reading waived. Court finds probable cause. State requests $500 cash bail.
Status hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
